required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Functional Neural Correlates of Transcutaneous Vagal Nerve Stimulation: Effects of Anatomical Site and Waveform Parameters - An Exploratory High Resolution fMRI Study in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: Transcutaneous vagal nerve stimulation (tVNS) has been applied to a number of disease areas including visceral pain, depression, cluster headache and Alzheimer's disease. However, there is marked heterogeneity in these studies pertaining to i) the anatomical site of stimulation (neck, inner concha or tragus of ear), and ii) the waveform parameters of the stimulating impulse. This exploratory cross-sectional study will address these knowledge gaps by comparative functional neuroimaging of the neural correlates of tVNS with disparate anatomical sites and electrical waveform characteristics during rest in healthy participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Blood oxygenation level dependent (BOLD) signal activity in the CAN during tVNS
primary_outcome.time_frame: During stimulation (difference between stim on - stim off blocks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Voxel-wise dependent BOLD signal activity in the NTS of the brainstem; somatosensory cortex; insular cortex; ACC, hypothalamus; thalamus and amygdala during auricular tVNS (parameter set 1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During stimulation (difference between stim on - stim off blocks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Voxel-wise dependent BOLD signal activity in the NTS of the brainstem; somatosensory cortex; insular cortex; ACC, hypothalamus; thalamus and amygdala during cervical tVNS )(parameter set 1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During stimulation (difference between stim on - stim off blocks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Voxel-wise dependent BOLD signal activity in the NTS of the brainstem; somatosensory cortex; insular cortex; ACC, hypothalamus; thalamus and amygdala during auricular tVNS (parameter set 2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During stimulation (difference between stim on - stim off blocks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Voxel-wise dependent BOLD signal activity in the NTS of the brainstem; somatosensory cortex; insular cortex; ACC, hypothalamus; thalamus and amygdala during cervical tVNS (parameter set 2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During stimulation (difference between stim on - stim off blocks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Voxel-wise dependent BOLD signal activity in the NTS of the brainstem; somatosensory cortex; insular cortex; ACC, hypothalamus; thalamus and amygdala during subliminal auricular tVNS (parameter set 1)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During stimulation (difference between stim on - stim off blocks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional connectivity / Network Connectivity of CAN regions during "active tVNS" block [to all 5 points as identified above]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During stimulation (difference between stim on - stim off blocks)

intervention.description: Cervical and auricular transcutaneous stimulation of the vagus nerve

study_pop.textblock: Female healthy volunteers aged between 18-40 years

eligibility.gender_description: Females only (in order to limit confounding)

facility.name: Queen Mary University of London. Wingate Institute of Neurogastroenterology
